page.title: 13TOURISM
page.content: Many people come to Durness for peace and quiet and wonderful scenery.There are lovely clean sandy beaches which are often deserted.Another attraction is Smoo Cave which is a very big and impressive cavern.Farriad Head is a good place for birdwatching as it has a lot of puffins and other sea birds on it.Dolphins and other sea mammals can sometimes been seen here too. Durness is also rich in plant life noteably the Scottish Primrose and some species of alpines.The many lochs and the River Dionard provide excellent fishing.Sailing and sea angling are also possible.There is a very good caravan and camping site,four hotels, and some excellent B&B's and guest houses.Sango Sands Oasis has a public bar,gift shop and a restaurant.
